handlers.name: Amazon S3
handlers.description: Amazon S3 'S3' stands for Simple Storage Service. This integration allows you to use S3 with very intricate yet compliant integration.

handlerList.name: Amazon S3 Expiring Url Generator
handlerList.description: Generate an expiring URL for S3.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler generates an expiring URL for S3. Expiring URLs take a bucket, a key (path + filename) and an expiration and build up a special URL that will give the user access to the file only for a certain time period. 


#### Authentication
This handler requires two info values for AWS authentication: Access Key ID and the Secret Access Key. These are analogous to username and password. 

To find authentication values from the AWS account: 



  1. Navigate to the following URL: https://aws.amazon.com/account/ 

  2. Click the "Security Credentials" link (if you are not logged in, you will be prompted to do so). 

  3. Click the "Access Credentials" link.  Here you will find a list of your Access Keys. 

  5. Use the Access Key ID to configure the access_key_id info value of this handler. 

  6. To retrieve the Secret Access Key, click the "Show" link next to the Access Key ID that will be used. 

  7. Use the Secret Access Key to configure the secret_access_key info value of this handler.

parameters.Region: Name of the region of the bucket (required if not specified as an info value).
parameters.Key: Name of the key in desired bucket (path + filename).
parameters.Seconds To Expire: Number of seconds in which URL will expire.  This may not exceed 604,800 seconds or one week.

results.Public Url: URL to desired bucket and key path for file.

1.description: * Initial version.  See README for details.

handlerList.changelogText:
Amazon S3 Expiring Url Generator V1 (2016-07-02)
* Initial version.  See README for details.

handlerList.name: Amazon S3 File Upload From Submission
handlerList.description: This handler uploads an existing file from a Kinetic Request CE submission to an Amazon S3 bucket.
handlerList.detailedDescription: This handler creates and uploads content from an existing Request CE submission field value to an Amazon S3 bucket and then returns a public url of the successfully uploaded file. This is done by using an account's Access Key and Secret Access Key to authenticate with the Amazon S3 server and then uploading the file retrieved from Request CE and its content into the specified S3 bucket.

parameters.Region: Id of the region the inteded S3 server is located in (can also be configured as an info value).
parameters.Space Slug: Slug for the space the submission is in (can also be configured as an info value).
parameters.Bucket: Name of the bucket to upload to.
parameters.File Name: Name that will be given to the file on upload (if not provided, will default to the default filename stored in Request CE).
parameters.Submission Id: Submission Id that the attachment is located on.
parameters.Field Label: Field Label for the attachment field.

results.Public Url: A public url for the file that was just uploaded.

1.description: * Initial version.  See README for details.

* Initial version.  See README for details.

handlerList.name: Amazon S3 File Upload
handlerList.description: This handler creates and uploads text content to an Amazon S3 Bucket
handlerList.detailedDescription: This handler creates and uploads text content to an Amazon S3 bucket and then returns a public url of the successfully uploaded file. This is done by using an account's Access Key and Secret Access Key to authenticate with the Amazon S3 server and then uploading the file and its content into the specified S3 bucket.

parameters.Region: Id of the region the inteded S3 server is located in.
parameters.Bucket: Name of the bucket to upload to.
parameters.File Name: Name of the file to upload.
parameters.File Content: String to upload as the contents of the new file.

results.Public Url: A public url for the file that was just uploaded.

handlers.name: BMC Remedy
handlers.description: BMC Remedy Action Request System (ARS) is an enterprise management platform that can be used to run many types of business applications. These applications may be pre-built (such as BMC Atrium CMDB, BMC Remedy Service Request Management, or BMC Remedy Help Desk) or custom developed.

handlerList.name: Remedy Generic Create
handlerList.description: Creates a single Remedy entry given the JSON mapping of field values and form name.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler takes a json as input of a format like {"DB field Name":"value to place in field"} and uses this to create a record in the specified form. 

At times, you may need to set Currency Fields in Remedy. This is accomplished by formatting the value as follows: ``` { ... "My Currency Field":{"value":100.0,"currency":"USD"}, ... } ``` The value portion must be parsed as a float. You can accomplish this as follows in the Field Values parameter: ``` <%= { 'Text Field 1' => 'ABCD-EFG', 'Text Field 2' => '123456', 'Currency Field 1' => {'value' => @inputs["Currency Input"].to_f, 'currency' => 'USD' }, }.to_json %> ```

sampleConfiguration.Field Values: {"Template Identifier":"<%=@answers['Template Identifier']%>","Template Name":"<%=@answers['Template Name']%>","Status Template":"<%=@answers['Template Status']%>","Template Category Tier 1":"<%=@answers['Template Category Tier 1']%>","Description":"<%=@answers['Summary']%>","Detailed Decription":"<%=@answers['Notes']%>","Reported Source":"<%=@answers['Reported Source']%>","Service Type":"<%=@answers['Incident Type']%>","Status":"<%=@answers['Status']%>","Impact":"<%=@answers['Impact']%>","Urgency":"<%=@answers['Urgency']%>","Assigned Support Company":"<%=@answers['Assigned Support Company']%>","Assigned Support Organization":"<%=@answers['Assigned Support Organization']%>","Assigned Group":"<%=@answers['Authoring Group']%>","Authoring Company":"<%=@answers['Authoring Company']%>","Authoring Organization":"<%=@answers['Authoring Organization']%>","Authoring Group":"<%=@answers['Authoring Group']%>"}

2.1.description: * Added check for Task version before loading JSON dependency so it will work with both Task 3 & 4.

2.description: *Added debug logging capability. Added JSON library so will work in Task 3.

handlerList.name: ARS9 Generic Query Retrieve
handlerList.description: Retrieves a single ARS v9.x entry related to the Remedy Form specified.
handlerList.detailedDescription: This handler returns all the fields for the query provided in the form specified.  This is returned in XML format (like below). ``` <field_list> <field id='Request ID'>000000000000001</field> <field id='Creator'>Action Request Installer Account</field> <field id='Create Date'>Mon Apr 25 16:42:22 -0400 2011</field> <field id='Assigned To'></field> <field id='Last Modified By'>Demo</field> <field id='Modified Date'>Wed Dec 07 11:46:47 -0500 2011</field> <field id='Status'>Current</field> </field_list> ``` Note that if there is more than one result, only the first is returned. The sorting (which is returned first) is determined by the server.

parameters.Error Handling: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.
parameters.Remedy Form:: Remedy Form Name (not display name), eg. People is CTM:People
parameters.Query:: Advanced Search Query of the record to retrieve

results.Handler Error Message: Error, if one is found
results.#FIELD NAME PLACE HOLDER#: This will actually be one result for each field on the form with the name of the field name and the result of the field content.

handlerList.name: Remedy Generic Find
handlerList.description: Retrieves request IDs (field 1) and Instance IDs (field 179) for Remedy entries for the form entered using the query specified.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler returns the request ids (field 1) for all records in the specified form that match the provided query.  This is returned in XML format (like below) for use in loops. 

<Request_Ids> <RequestId>000000000000013</RequestId> <RequestId>000000000000381</RequestId> <RequestId>000000000002582</RequestId> </Request_Ids> 

It also returns the instance ids (field 179) in a similar format: 

<Instance_Ids> <InstanceId>AG0050569A648CU5tSUAUcZMAgc8AC</InstanceId> <InstanceId>AG0050569A648ClZtSUAkMVNAgVcYC</InstanceId> <InstanceId>AG0050569A648CMZtSUAKUBMAgMrkC</InstanceId> </Instance_Ids> 

It also returns a count of the number of records found. It returns zero if there were no matches (not nil).

parameters.Remedy Form:: Remedy Form Name (not display name), eg. People is CTM:People

handlerList.changelogText:
Remedy Generic Find (2012-05-29)
 * Initial version.  See README for details.

V2
 *Added instance ID list to returned values.
 
V3
 *Generic Handler could not use the preinitialize_on_first_load method.  Instead get_remedy_form is used to load the form and add it to the cache

 V4
  *Added a count to the returned values.
  
 V4 Update (2017-Jun-27)
 *Made it possible to return 0 values without causing/raising error.

handlerList.name: BMC Execute Process
handlerList.description: Submits an Execute Process command to the server
handlerList.detailedDescription: Executes the command on the server exactly as submitted.  The command string can use results of other actions, such as ticket numbers, in its call.  The first example above adds an approver to a change request, using very specific parameters.  Refer to BMC's documentation for paramters that may require wrapping in quotation marks.

parameters.Command:: The full text of the command (including any parameters) to be sent to the server
parameters.Wait for server response:: Do you want to wait for the server's response -- Yes or No

results.Return Value: The value returned by the server after executing the command.  The value will be blank if the 'Wait for Server Response' field is set to "No".  It will also be empty if the command returns no values (e.g., commands to delete entries from forms).
results.Return Status: The exit code returned by the process. Zero means success.

handlers.name: BMC Remedy ITSM
handlers.description: An IT Service Management (ITSM) solution built on top of the BMC Action Request platform. ITSM is an approach to managing large-scale IT systems and processes focusing on the customer perspective of service delivery (as opposed to technology-centric).

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM8 Assoc to Change Request Create
handlerList.description: Attaches an item to a Change Request.  (A second handler is needed to attach the change request to related item.)
handlerList.detailedDescription: This handler creates a record in the CHG:Associations form based on the information input by the end user, and returns the Request ID of the record created.  The handler is just half of the equation. It should be used in conjunction with bmc_itsm8_assoc_to_asset_create handler.

parameters.Lookup Keyword: The lookup keyword the item (for CMDB relationships, the ClassID ex: BMC_COMPUTERSYSTEM)
parameters.Form Name 01: Form Name 01 (for CMDB relationships, the Asset form name, ex: AST:ComputerSystem
parameters.Form Name 02: Form Name 02 (the change form name, ex: CHG:Infrastructure Change)
parameters.Related Item ReconID: Reconciliation ID of the item being related

results.CHG:Associations Entry ID: The Request ID of the CHG:Associations record that was created.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM9 Change Templated Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM9 Infrastructure Change record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the specified Change Template and data parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Change Requests are submitted through the CHG:ChangeInterface_Create form. When creating Change Requests via the Infrastructure Change Template facility, the Instance Id of related template is retreived using the template name parameter. The Instance Id is mapped to the TemplateID field on the CHG:ChangeInterface_Create form.  This causes Remedy workflow to map values from the template into the CHG:Infrastructure Change (Changes) form. 

Additional information about the usage of Infrastructure Change Templates can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Configurations guide. 

The following data is used to create the 'CHG:ChangeInterface_Create' record: 

* Sets the 'TemplateID' field to the Instance Id of the Change template that was specified in the "Change Template Name" parameter. 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 



* Sets the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'First Name'            => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Last Name'             => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'Customer Internet E-mail' => "Requester Email" 

  - 'Company'               => "Requester Support Company" 

  - 'Submitter'             => "Submitter Login Id" 

  - 'Company3'              => "Change Manager Support Company" 

  - 'Support Organization'  => "Change Manager Support Organization" 

  - 'Support Group Name'    => "Change Manager Support Group Name" 

  - 'SRID'                  => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'          => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id).

parameters.Error Handling: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.
parameters.Change Template Name:: The name of the change template to be used.  Change templates are retrieved from CHG:Template.
parameters.Requester First Name:: Used to find the Requester for the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Requester Last Name:: Used to find the Requester for the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Requester Login ID:: Used to find the Requester for the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Requester Support Company:: Sets the Support Company on the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: Sets the Submitter on the Dates tab under the Change Dates header.
parameters.Change Manager Support Company:: Sets the Support Company on the Assignment tab under the Infrastructure Change Manage header.
parameters.Change Manager Support Organization: Sets the Support Organization on the Assignment tab under the Infrastructure Change Manage header.
parameters.Change Manager Support Group Name: Sets the Support Group Name on the Assignment tab under the Infrastructure Change Manage header.
parameters.Survey ID (KSR #):: The value placed in the SRID field on the Change form.
parameters.Survey Instance ID:: The value placed in the SRInstanceID field on the Change form.

results.Change Number: The 'Infrastructure Change Id' of the generated Change in the 'CHG:Infrastructure Change' form.
results.Change Instance Id: The 'InstanceId' of the generated Change in the 'CHG:Infrastructure Change' form.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident Work Info Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Incident (Help Desk) Work Info record based upon the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Creates Work Info entries related to an Incident.  The relationship is established by placing the Incident Number in the 'Incident Number' field on the 'HPD:Work Log' form. 

The Include Review Request parameter invokes a method that builds and places a link in the Notes field on the Work Info entry.  When this link is clicked, the original service request submission is opened in the read-only Review Request mode. 

The Include Question Answers parameter invokes a method which builds a question and answer pair display of the service request submittal. These data elements are  placed in the Notes field of the Work Info entry.  This provides a quick view of the triggering service request submittal data. 

The Work Info entry accommodates up to three file attachments.  When configuring the task, this handler expects the value Menu Label of the attachment question. The handler will use this name to locate the attachment file within the Remedy forms of the Kinetic Request application. If more than three attachments are needed, it is recommended to create additional Work Info entries. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters. 



The following data is used to create the 'HPD:Worklog' record: 

* Sets the 'Detailed Description' field to a concatenation of the following: 

  - The URL link to the Review Request view of the triggering Kinetic Request submission (if provided). 

  - The value of the "Work Info Notes" parameter. 

  - The formatted string of Question name to full answer pairs (if provided). 

* Sets the 'Incident Entry ID' field to the result of a lookup to the HPD:Help Desk form.  The lookup is done using the incident number parameter and the resulting entry's request id is used. 

* Attaches the files associated to the specified Attachment field menu label parameters to the specified fields: 

  - 'z2AF Work Log01'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 1" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log02'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 2" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log03'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 3" 

* Sets the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'Communication Source'     => "Web" 

  - 'z1D Previous Operation'   => "SET" 

  - 'Status'                   => "Enabled" 

  - 'Work Log Type'            => "General Information" 

* Sets the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Incident Number'          => "Incident Number" 

  - 'Description'              => "Work Info Summary" 

  - 'Detailed Description'     => "Work Info Notes" 

  - 'Work Log Date'            => "Work Info Submit Date" 

  - 'Work Log Submitter'       => "Submitter" 

  - 'Secure Work Log'          => "Locked" 

  - 'View Access'              => "View Access"

parameters.Incident Number:: The incident number of the Incident to associate the Incident Work Info entry with.
parameters.Include Review Request:: Option to prepend the review request URL to the Notes of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Include Question Answers:: Option to append the question answer pairs to the Notes of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Summary:: Sets the Summary of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Notes:: Sets the Notes of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Submit Date:: Sets the Date of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 1:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 2:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 3:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Submitter:: Sets the Submitter of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Locked:: Sets the Incident Work Info entry Locked status.
parameters.View Access:: Sets the Incident Work Info entry to Public or Internal.
parameters.Customer Survey Instance ID:: Instance ID of the submission that should be used to retrieve answers.
parameters.Survey Template Instance ID:: The survey template instance ID related to the Customer Survey Instance ID.
parameters.Default Web Server:: Instance ID of the submission that should be used to retrieve answers.

results.Entry Id: The Request Id of the generated Incident Work Info entry.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Change Work Info Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Infrastructure Change Work Info record based upon the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Creates Work Info entries related to a Change Request.  The relationship is established by placing the Change Number in the Infrastructure Change ID field on the CHG:Work Log form. 

The Include Review Request parameter invokes a method that builds and places a link in the Notes field on the Work Info entry.  When this link is clicked, the original service request submission is opened in the read-only Review Request mode. 

The Include Question Answers parameter invokes a method which builds a question and answer pair display of the service request submittal. These data elements are  placed in the Notes field of the Work Info entry.  This provides a quick view of the triggering service request submittal data. 

The Work Info entry accommodates up to three file attachments.  When configuring the task, this handler expects the value Menu Label of the attachment question. The handler will use this name to locate the attachment file within the Remedy forms of the Kinetic Request application. If more than three attachments are needed, it is recommended to create additional Work Info entries. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters. 

The following data is used to create the 'CHG:Worklog' record: 

* Sets the 'Detailed Description' field to a concatenation of the following: 

  - The URL link to the Review Request view of the triggering Kinetic Request submission (if provided). 

  - The value of the "Work Info Notes" parameter. 

  - The formatted string of Question name to full answer pairs (if provided). 

* Sets the 'Infra. Change Entry ID' field to the result of a lookup to the CHG:Infrastructure Change form.  The lookup is done using the change number parameter and the resulting entry's request id is used. 

* Attaches the files associated to the specified Attachment field menu label parameters to the specified fields: 

  - 'z2AF Work Log01'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 1" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log02'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 2" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log03'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 3" 

* Sets the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'Communication Source'     => "Web" 

  - 'z1D Previous Operation'   => "SET" 

  - 'Status'                   => "Enabled" 

  - 'Work Log Type'            => "General Information" 

* Sets the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Infra. Change Entry ID'   => "Change Number" 

  - 'Infrastructure Change ID' => "Change Number" 

  - 'Description'              => "Work Info Summary" 

  - 'Detailed Description'     => "Work Info Notes" 

  - 'Work Log Date'            => "Work Info Submit Date" 

  - 'Work Log Submitter'       => "Submitter" 

  - 'Secure Work Log'          => "Locked" 

  - 'View Access'              => "View Access"

parameters.Change Number:: The change number of the Change to associate the Change Work Info entry with.
parameters.Include Review Request:: Option to prepend the review request URL to the Notes of the Change Work Info entry.
parameters.Include Question Answers:: Option to append the question answer pairs to the Notes of the Change Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Summary:: Sets the Summary of the Change Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Notes:: Sets the Notes of the Change Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Submit Date:: Sets the Date of the Change Work Info entry.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 1:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 2:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 3:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Submitter:: Sets the Submitter of the Change Work Info entry.
parameters.Locked:: Sets the Incident Work Info entry Locked status.
parameters.View Access:: Sets the Incident Work Info entry to Public or Internal.
parameters.Customer Survey Instance ID:: Instance ID of the submission that should be used to retrieve answers.
parameters.Survey Template Instance ID:: The survey template instance ID related to the Customer Survey Instance ID.
parameters.Default Web Server:: Instance ID of the submission that should be used to retrieve answers.

results.Entry Id: The Request Id of the generated Change Work Info entry.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM9 Person Update
handlerList.description: Updates an entry in the People form based on the Remedy Login ID.  Use the key word nil to clear a value.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Updates a single ITSM v9.x CTM People entry related to the Remedy Login specified with the REST API. 

Note: If a site is provided and a site ID is not, an error will occur. If a site is provided without city, country, state, street, timezone, and zip/postal code information, the site will be set, but the "Site Address" field in CTM:People will still display the old location/address. 

Note: If one component of the phone number is passed, all 4 should be.

parameters.Error Handling: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.
parameters.Remedy Login ID:: The Remedy Login ID associated to the CTM People record to update.
parameters.Middle Name:: The Middle Name/Initial to set, Optional
parameters.Client Type:: The Client Type to set, often 'Office-Based Employee' or 'Contractor' or 'Customer'. Must be valid option of menu.
parameters.Client Sensitivity:: The Client Sensitivity to set. Either Standard or Sensitive.
parameters.VIP:: The VIP value to set. Yes or No
parameters.Author:: The author of the creation to the person record.
parameters.CC Business:: The phone number country code to set
parameters.Area Code Business:: The phone number area code to set
parameters.Local Part Business Phone:: The phone number local part to set
parameters.Business Phone:: The phone number (put together) to set
parameters.Language: The language to set (ex. en_US, fr_FR)

results.Handler Error Message: Error, if one is found

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Work Order Work Info Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Work Order Work Info record based upon the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Creates Work Info entries related to a Work Order.  The relationship is established by placing the Work Order ID in the 'Work Order ID' field on the 'WOI:WorkInfo' form. 

The Include Review Request parameter invokes a method that builds and places a link in the Notes field on the Work Info entry.  When this link is clicked, the original service request submission is opened in the read-only Review Request mode. 

The Include Question Answers parameter invokes a method which builds a question and answer pair display of the service request submittal. These data elements are  placed in the Notes field of the Work Info entry.  This provides a quick view of the triggering service request submittal data. 

The Work Info entry accommodates up to three file attachments.  When configuring the task, this handler expects the value Menu Label of the attachment question. The handler will use this name to locate the attachment file within the Remedy forms of the Kinetic Request application. If more than three attachments are needed, it is recommended to create additional Work Info entries. 

The following data is used to create the 'WOI:WorkInfo' record: 

* Sets the 'Detailed Description' field to a concatenation of the following: 

  - The URL link to the Review Request view of the triggering Kinetic Request submission (if provided). 

  - The value of the "Work Info Notes" parameter. 

  - The formatted string of Question name to full answer pairs (if provided). 

* Sets the 'Work Order Entry ID' field to the result of a lookup to the WOI:WorkOrder form.  The lookup is done using the work order id parameter and the resulting entry's request id is used. 

* Attaches the files associated to the specified Attachment field menu label parameters to the specified fields: 

  - 'z2AF Work Log01'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 1" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log02'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 2" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log03'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 3" 

* Sets the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'Secure Work Log'          => "No" 

  - 'View Access'              => "Internal" 

  - 'Communication Source'     => "Web" 

  - 'z1D Previous Operation'   => "SET" 

  - 'Status'                   => "Enabled" 

  - 'Work Log Type'            => "General Information" 

* Sets the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Work Order ID'		       => "Work Order ID" 

  - 'Description'              => "Work Info Summary" 

  - 'Detailed Description'     => "Work Info Notes" 

  - 'Work Log Date'            => "Work Info Submit Date" 

  - 'Work Log Submitter'       => "Submitter"

parameters.Work Order ID:: The work order id number of the work order to associate the Work Order Work Info entry with.
parameters.Include Review Request:: Option to prepend the review request URL to the Notes of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Include Question Answers:: Option to append the question answer pairs to the Notes of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Summary:: Sets the Summary of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Notes:: Sets the Notes of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Submit Date:: Sets the Date of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 1:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 2:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Question Menu Label 3:: The menu label of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Submitter:: Sets the Submitter of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Locked:: Sets the Work Order Work Info entry Locked status.
parameters.View Access:: Sets the Work Order Work Info entry to Public or Internal.
parameters.Work Info Source:: Sets the Work Order Work Info Communication Source value.  Options include to Email, Fax, Phone, Voice Mail, Walk In, Pager, System Assignment, Web, and Other.
parameters.Work Info Type:: Sets the Work Order Work Info Type value.  Many options exist for this field.  The most commonly used is 'General Information'
parameters.Source Instance ID:: The instance id of the submission you want data returned from.  Typically the originating service item in a parent/child scenario.
parameters.Source Survey Template ID:: The instance id of the survey template you want data returned from.
parameters.Default Web Server:: Instance ID of the submission that should be used to retrieve answers.

results.Entry Id: The Request Id of the generated Work Order Work Info entry.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Change Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Infrastructure Change record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Change Requests are submitted through the CHG:ChangeInterface_Create form. This staging form provides an easy and reliable way to raise Change Requests in the ITSM application. 

Additional information about the usage of the CHG:ChangeInterface_Create form can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Service Management Integrations guide. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters. 

The following data is used to create the 'CHG:ChangeInterface_Create' record: 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 

* Maps the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'z1D_Action'           => "CREATE" 

  - 'Status'               => "Draft" 

  - 'Change Type'          => "Change" 

  - 'Change Timing'        => "Normal" 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Description'          => "Change Summary" 

  - 'Impact'               => "Impact" 

  - 'Urgency'              => "Urgency" 

  - 'Risk Level'           => "Risk Level" 

  - 'First Name'           => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Last Name'            => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'Company'              => "Requester Support Company" 

  - 'Submitter'            => "Submitter Login Id" 

  - 'Location Company'     => "Change Location Company" 

  - 'Company3'             => "Change Manager Support Company" 

  - 'Support Organization' => "Change Manager Support Organization" 

  - 'Support Group Name'   => "Change Manager Support Group Name" 

  - 'SRID'                 => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'         => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id).

parameters.Change Summary:: Sets the Summary in the Change Request Information section.
parameters.Impact:: Sets the Impact in the Change Request Information section.
parameters.Urgency:: Sets the Urgency in the Change Request Information section.
parameters.Risk Level:: Sets the Risk Level in the Change Request Information section.
parameters.Requester First Name:: Sets the First Name on the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Requester Last Name:: Sets the Last Name on the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Requester Support Company:: Sets the Support Company on the Requester tab under the Requested By header.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: Sets the Submitter on the Dates tab under the Change Dates header.
parameters.Change Location Company:: Sets the Company on the Requester tab under the Change Location header.
parameters.Change Manager Support Company:: Sets the Support Company on the Assignment tab under the Infrastructure Change Manage header.
parameters.Change Manager Support Organization: Sets the Support Organization on the Assignment tab under the Infrastructure Change Manage header.
parameters.Change Manager Support Group Name: Sets the Support Group Name on the Assignment tab under the Infrastructure Change Manage header.
parameters.Survey ID (KSR #):: The value placed in the SRID field on the Change form.
parameters.Survey Instance ID:: The value placed in the SRInstanceID field on the Change form.

results.Change Number: The 'Infrastructure Change Id' of the generated Change in the 'CHG:Infrastructure Change' form.
results.Change Instance Id: The 'InstanceId' of the generated Change in the 'CHG:Infrastructure Change' form.
results.Deferral Token: The deferral token used by this handler.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Task Templated Create
handlerList.description: Creates a TMS:Task entry that belongs to either a Change or Incident record.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler uses the task_fields section of the node.xml to create an entry on the TMS:Task form.  Then the 'Instanceid' of the created TMS:Task entry is used to retrieve the related TMS:Association entry that was generated by workflow. Finally the 'InstanceId' of the TMS:Task and TMS:Association records are used in addition to the flow_builder section of the node.xml to create an entry on TMS:FlowBuilder. 

This handler requires ARS Models v0.1.3 because this handler creates an entry on a display only form(TMS:FlowBuilder)

parameters.Task Name: Sets the 'Name' field of the TMS:Task record
parameters.Task Location Company: Sets the 'Location Company' field of the TMS:Task entry
parameters.Parent Form Name: The form of the parent record, either CHG:Infrastructure Change or HPD:Help Desk or Kinetic Request
parameters.Parent Id: The display id of the parent record, which is either a Change or an Incident record
parameters.ParentInstance Id: The instance id of the parent record, which is either a Change or an Incident record

results.Task Id: The 'InstanceId' of the TMS:Task entry created by this handler.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident Templated Create Detail
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Incident (Help Desk) record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the specified Incident Template and parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Incidents are submitted through the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form. When creating Incidents via the Incident Management Template facility, the Instance Id of related template is retrieved using the template name parameter. The Instance Id is mapped to the TemplateID field on the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form.  This causes Remedy workflow to map values from the template into the 'HPD:Help Desk' (Incidents) form.  Any specified parameters provided will override that field as specified in the template used. 

Additional information about the usage of Incident Management Templates can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Configurations guide. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters. 

The following data is used to create the 'HPD:IncidentInterface_Create' record: 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 

* Maps the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'z1D_Action'           => "CREATE" 

  - 'Reported Source'      => "Web" 

  - 'Status'               => "New" 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Last_Name'            => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'First_Name'           => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Submitter'            => "Submitter Login Id" 

  - 'Service_Type'         => "Service Type" 

  - 'Description'		   => "Summary" 

  - 'Detailed_Description' => "Notes" 

  - 'Impact'			   => "Impact" 

  - 'Urgency'			   => "Urgency" 

  - 'SRID'                 => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'         => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id).

parameters.Incident Template Name:: The name of the incident template to submit with.
parameters.Requester First Name:: The value placed in the First Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Requester Last Name:: The value placed in the Last Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: The value placed in the Submitter field on the Incident form.
parameters.Contact First Name:: The value placed in the Contact First Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Contact Last Name:: The value placed in the Contact Last Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Summary:: The value placed in the Summary field on the Incident form.
parameters.Notes:: The value placed in the Notes field on the Incident form. (Will append with any Notes Values in the Template)
parameters.Service Type:: The Service Type (eg. User Service Request or User Service Restoration) value placed in the Notes field on the Incident form.
parameters.Impact:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Urgency:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Operational Category 1:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Operational Category 2:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Operational Category 3:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Product Category 1:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Product Category 2:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Product Category 3:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Product Name:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Product Model/Version:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Product Manufacturer:: Should be exactly equal to the text visible in Remedy for this field.
parameters.Survey ID (KSR #):: The value placed in the SRID field on the Incident form.
parameters.Survey Instance ID:: The value placed in the SRInstanceID field on the Incident form.

results.Incident Number: The 'Incident Number' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.
results.Incident Instance Id: The 'InstanceId' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.
results.Status: The 'Status' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.
results.Resolution: The 'Resolution' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.
results.LMD: The 'Last Modified Date' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.

handlerList.name: BMC SRM Templated Work Order Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Work Order record based on a given a Work Order Template.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler uses the WOI:WorkOrderInterface_Create form & functionality in ITSM to create work orders. This handler allows for creation of a work order using a template, but allowing the detail fields to be populated with request data. 

Note that in 7.6.X version of ITSM, there have been issues reported with using WOI:WorkOrderInterface_Create to create work orders. This may need to be repaired in ITSM before this can effectively be used, but no changes are necessary in the handler. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters.

parameters.Work Order Template:: Name of the work order template to be used.
parameters.Work Order Summary:: The value placed in the Summary field on the Work Order form. Leave empty to use the Summary defined in the WO Template.
parameters.Work Order Notes:: The value placed in the Notes field on the Work Order form. Leave empty to use the Notes defined in the WO Template.
parameters.Requester Login Id:: Login Id of the person making the request. This will be used to retrive the Person ID and place it in the Customer People ID field.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: Login Id of the person submitting the request. This will be used to retrive the Person ID and place it in the Requested By People ID field.
parameters.Survey ID (KSR #):: The value placed in the SRID field on the Work Order form.
parameters.Survey Instance ID:: The value placed in the SRInstanceID field on the Work Order form.

handlerList.detailedDescription:
Incidents are submitted through the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form. When creating Incidents via the Incident Management Template facility, the Instance Id of related template is retrieved using the template name parameter. The Instance Id is mapped to the TemplateID field on the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form.  This causes Remedy workflow to map values from the template into the 'HPD:Help Desk' (Incidents) form. 

Additional information about the usage of Incident Management Templates can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Configurations guide. 

The following data is used to create the 'HPD:IncidentInterface_Create' record: 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 

* Maps the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'Reported Source'      => "Web" 

  - 'Service_Type'         => "User Service Request" 

  - 'Status'               => "New" 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Last_Name'            => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'First_Name'           => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Login_ID'             => "Requester Login Id" 

  - 'Submitter'            => "Submitter Login Id" 

  - 'SRID'                 => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'         => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id).

parameters.Error Handling: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident to Incident Relationship Create
handlerList.description: Creates a relationship between two ITSM7 incidents using the HPD:Associations form
handlerList.detailedDescription:
A proper relationship between two Incidents within ITSM is to have two relationships, Ticket 1 to Ticket 2, and Ticket 2 to Ticket 1.  Use two task nodes for this, as the input parameter values are switched between the two HPD:Associations records. 

The following data is used to create the 'HPD:Associations' record: 

* References the summary field values for the identified tickets from the HPD:Help Desk form. 

  - 'Request Description01'         => Value returned by the lookup of the summary description of Incident Number 1 

* Maps the following field values of the HPD_Associations form to the field values provided: 

  - 'Form Name01'                   => 'HPD:Help Desk' 

  - 'Form Name02'                   => 'HPD:Help Desk' 

  - 'Request Type01'                => 'Incident' 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Request ID01'                  => "Incident Number 1" 

  - 'Request ID02'                  => "Incident Number 2" 

  - 'Association Type01'            => "Association Type"

parameters.Incident Number 1:: The incident number for one side of the relationship.
parameters.Incident Number 2:: The incident number for the other sise of the relationship.
parameters.Association type:: The type of relationship being created.
parameters.Submitters Login ID:: The Remedy login ID of the user to identify as the submitter of the relationship.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Approver Retrieve by Role
handlerList.description: Retrieves a list of approvers for the role provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
AP:Role is an ITSM 7 form that stores the approvers for Roles defined.  This handler retrieves the approvers (Member List) for the specified role in XML format so this data can be used in a loop to generate approvals. Note that this handler will only return data for active roles. It also returns either "One Must Sign" or "All Must Sign" to indicate the appropriate action if there are multiple approvers. 

The user IDs are reutrned in the following format: <userIds> <userId>Demo</userId> <userId>Mary Manager</userId> </userIds>

parameters.Role Name: The Role Name to send approvals to

results.userIdList: The user Ids of the records being retrieved.
results.ifMultiple: The 'First Name' field data of the record being retrieved.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Person Update
handlerList.description: Updates an ITSM v7.x CTM People entry given the Remedy Login Id.  It only updates the record with the given values if those values are provided (will not null out values).  It also creates a WorkLog entry to audit the modification.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Updates a single ITSM v7.x CTM People entry related to the Remedy Login specified. 

Note: If a site is provided and a site ID is not, an error will occur. If a site is provided without city, country, state, street, timezone, and zip/postal code information, the site will be set, but the "Site Address" field in CTM:People will still display the old location/address. 

Note: If one component of the phone number is passed, all 4 should be.

parameters.Remedy Login ID:: The Remedy Login ID associated to the CTM People record to update.
parameters.Author:: The author of the modifications to the person record.
parameters.Site ID:: The site id to set - required if setting site
parameters.Site City:: The site city to set - required if setting site (to correctly populate address)
parameters.Site Country:: The site county to set - required if setting site (to correctly populate address)
parameters.Site State/Province:: The site state/province to set - required if setting site (to correctly populate address)
parameters.Site Street:: The site street to set - required if setting site (to correctly populate address)
parameters.Site Zip/Postal Code:: The site zip/postal code to set - required if setting site (to correctly populate address)
parameters.Site Time Zone:: The site time zone to set - required if setting site (to correctly populate address)
parameters.CC Business:: The phone number country code to set
parameters.Area Code Business:: The phone number area code to set
parameters.Local Part Business Phone:: The phone number local part to set
parameters.Business Phone:: The phone number (put together) to set
parameters.Language: The language to set (ex. en_US, fr_FR)

handlerList.description: Retrieves Email Address(es) for the individual or support group, separated by commas.

If the remedy login id that is passed as the parameter has no alternate approvers, the CTM:People record will be related to that remedy login id.  Otherwise, it searches through the chain of alternte approvers until an approver with no alternates is found. handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Incident (Help Desk) record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Incidents are submitted through the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form. This staging form provides an easy and reliable way to raise Incidents in the ITSM application. 

Additional information about the usage of the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Service Management Integrations guide. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters. 

The following data is used to create the 'HPD:IncidentInterface_Create' record: 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 

* Maps the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'z1D_Action'                    => "CREATE" 

  - 'Reported Source'               => "Web" 

  - 'Service_Type'                  => "User Service Request" 

  - 'Status'                        => "New" 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Impact'                        => "Impact" 

  - 'Urgency'                       => "Urgency" 

  - 'Description'                   => "Incident Summary" 

  - 'Assigned Support Company'      => "Assigned Support Company" 

  - 'Assigned Support Organization' => "Assigned Support Organization" 

  - 'Assigned Group'                => "Assigned Support Group" 

  - 'First_Name'                    => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Last_Name'                     => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'Submitter'                     => "Submitter Login Id" 

  - 'SRID'                          => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'                  => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id)

parameters.Requester First Name:: The value placed in the First Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Requester Last Name:: The value placed in the Last Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: The value placed in the Submitter field on the Incident form.
parameters.Incident Summary:: The value placed in the Summary field on the Incident form.
parameters.Impact:: The value placed in the Impact field on the Incident form.
parameters.Urgency:: The value placed in the Urgency field on the Incident form.
parameters.Assigned Support Company:: The value placed in the Assigned Support Company field on the Incident form.
parameters.Assigned Support Organization:: The value placed in the  Assigned Support Organization field on the Incident form.
parameters.Assigned Support Group:: The value placed in the Assigned Support Group field on the Incident form.
parameters.Survey ID (KSR #):: The value placed in the SRID field on the Incident form.
parameters.Survey Instance ID:: The value placed in the SRInstanceID field on the Incident form.

results.Incident Number: The 'Incident Number' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.
results.Incident Instance Id: The 'InstanceId' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Work Order Work Info Create CE
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Work Order Work Info record based upon the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Creates Work Info entries related to a Work Order.  The relationship is established by placing the Work Order ID in the 'Work Order ID' field on the 'WOI:WorkInfo' form. 

The Include Review Request parameter invokes a method that builds and places a link in the Notes field on the Work Info entry.  When this link is clicked, the original service request submission is opened in the read-only Review Request mode. 

The Include Question Answers parameter invokes a method which builds a question and answer pair display of the service request submittal. These data elements are  placed in the Notes field of the Work Info entry.  This provides a quick view of the triggering service request submittal data. 

The Work Info entry accommodates up to three file attachments.  When configuring the task, this handler expects the value Menu Label of the attachment question. The handler will use this name to locate the attachment file within the Remedy forms of the Kinetic Request application. If more than three attachments are needed, it is recommended to create additional Work Info entries. 

The following data is used to create the 'WOI:WorkInfo' record: 

* Sets the 'Detailed Description' field to a concatenation of the following: 

  - The URL link to the Review Request view of the triggering Kinetic Request submission (if provided). 

  - The value of the "Work Info Notes" parameter. 

  - The formatted string of Question name to full answer pairs (if provided). 

* Sets the 'Work Order Entry ID' field to the result of a lookup to the WOI:WorkOrder form.  The lookup is done using the work order id parameter and the resulting entry's request id is used. 

* Attaches the files associated to the specified Attachment field menu label parameters to the specified fields: 

  - 'z2AF Work Log01'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 1" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log02'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 2" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log03'          => "Attachment Question Menu Label 3" 

* Sets the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'Secure Work Log'          => "No" 

  - 'View Access'              => "Internal" 

  - 'Communication Source'     => "Web" 

  - 'z1D Previous Operation'   => "SET" 

  - 'Status'                   => "Enabled" 

  - 'Work Log Type'            => "General Information" 

* Sets the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Work Order ID'		       => "Work Order ID" 

  - 'Description'              => "Work Info Summary" 

  - 'Detailed Description'     => "Work Info Notes" 

  - 'Work Log Date'            => "Work Info Submit Date" 

  - 'Work Log Submitter'       => "Submitter"

parameters.Work Order ID:: The work order id number of the work order to associate the Work Order Work Info entry with.
parameters.Include Review Request:: Option to prepend the review request URL to the Notes of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Include Question Answers:: Option to append the question answer pairs to the Notes of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Summary:: Sets the Summary of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Notes:: Sets the Notes of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Work Info Submit Date:: Sets the Date of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Attachment Input Type: Choose Field if the input for the attachment info as a Field Name or choose JSON if the input is an attachment's JSON from the Get Attachment Info handler. Note that if Field is specified, the fields entered should only allow one attachment.
parameters.Attachment Field 1:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Field 2:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment Field 3:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment JSON 1:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment JSON 2:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment JSON 3:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Submitter:: Sets the Submitter of the Work Order Work Info entry.
parameters.Locked:: Sets the Work Order Work Info entry Locked status.
parameters.View Access:: Sets the Work Order Work Info entry to Public or Internal.
parameters.Work Info Source:: Sets the Work Order Work Info Communication Source value.  Options include to Email, Fax, Phone, Voice Mail, Walk In, Pager, System Assignment, Web, and Other.
parameters.Work Info Type:: Sets the Work Order Work Info Type value.  Many options exist for this field.  The most commonly used is 'General Information'
parameters.Submission ID:: The id of the CE submission to retrieve answers for.
parameters.Space Slug:: Can be used to override the info parameter provided.

results.Entry Id: The Request Id of the generated Work Order Work Info entry.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Approval Approve
handlerList.description: Approves a specific AP:Detail-Signature record.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler approves a specific AP:Detail-Signature record. If the approver specified is actually an alternate, the approval will note the approver they are an alternate for as the approver and them as the alternate. If the approver specified is not a valid approver or alternate, the handler will error. 

Note that the record ID is a join form record ID and is the two 15 digit numbers separated by a pipe character.

parameters.Approver: The approver the handler should log in as. This should be the approver for approvers and the alternate if an alternate is approving.
parameters.Approval Record ID: The unique ID (field 1) for the Approval Detail-Signatre Record to be approved
parameters.Approval Status: Whether the approval was approved or rejected. Valid Values: Approved, Rejected, Hold, More Information, Cancelled

results.Date Approved: The Date/Time that the Approval was submitted.

  - 'Work Log Date'            => "Work Info Submit Date"

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident Create Detail
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Incident (Help Desk) record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Incidents are submitted through the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form. This staging form provides an easy and reliable way to raise Incidents in the ITSM application. 

Additional information about the usage of the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Service Management Integrations guide. 

The following data is used to create the 'HPD:IncidentInterface_Create' record: 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 

* Maps the following field values to the field values of the KS_SRV_CustomerSurvey_base record that triggered the task process: 

  - 'SRID'                          => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'                  => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id). 

* Maps the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'z1D_Action'                    => "CREATE" 

  - 'Reported Source'               => "Web" 

  - 'Service_Type'                  => "User Service Request" 

  - 'Status'                        => "New" 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Impact'                        => "Impact" 

  - 'Urgency'                       => "Urgency" 

  - 'Description'                   => "Incident Summary" 

  - 'Assigned Support Company'      => "Assigned Support Company" 

  - 'Assigned Support Organization' => "Assigned Support Organization" 

  - 'Assigned Group'                => "Assigned Support Group" 

  - 'First_Name'                    => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Last_Name'                     => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'Submitter'                     => "Submitter Login Id"

parameters.KSR Instance ID:: The KSR Base record instance ID relating to this incident.

parameters.Contact First Name:: The value placed in the Direct Contact First Name field on the Incident form.

parameters.Contact Email:: The value placed in the Direct Contact Internet E-Mail field on the Incident form.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: The value placed in the Submitter field on the Incident form.
parameters.Incident Summary:: The value placed in the Summary field on the Incident form.
parameters.Incident Details:: The value placed in the Description field on the Incident form.
parameters.Resolution:: The value placed in the Resolution field on the Incident form.
parameters.Resolution Cat Tier 1:: The value placed in the Resolution Categorization Tier 1 field on the Incident form.

parameters.Assigned Support Group:: The value placed in the Assigned Support Group field on the Incident form.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Change Retrieve
handlerList.description: Retrieves a single ITSM Change entry.

parameters.Search By:: The Search By parameter has two options, and configures which field the handler will use in its search qualification
parameters.Search Value: The Search Value parameter is the value of the Search By field on the record  that will be retrieved

results.Actual End Date: Actual end date of the change. Date/time formatted as: Sat Jun 15 00:00:00-0500 2013
results.Actual Start Date: Actual start date of the change. Date/time formatted as: Sat Jun 15 00:00:00-0500 2013
results.Change Timing: Defined type of change timing. This may show as 'Class' on the BMC Change form. A few stock BMC values include: Emergency, Expedited, Latent, Normal
results.Company: Chosen company that change applies to.
results.Completed Date: When the change was completed. Date/time formatted as: Sat Jun 15 00:00:00-0500 2013
results.Description: Description for the change. This field maps to what will likely show up on the BMC change form as 'Summary'.
results.Detailed Description: Detailed description for the change. This field maps to what will likely show up on the BMC change form as 'Notes'.
results.Earliest Start Date: Earliest possible start date for the change. Date/time formatted as: Sat Jun 15 00:00:00-0500 2013
results.First Name: First name of the requester for the request.
results.Impact: Chosen impact value for the change. The value returned for this field will be formatted as it is displayed on the form. For example: 4-Minor/Localized
results.Last Name: Last name of the requester for the request.
results.Location Company: Chosen company that the change applies. Filled out on the change form from the 'Location Change'.
results.Risk Level: Calculated risk value of the change. The value returned for this field will be formatted as it is displayed on the form. For example: Risk Level 4
results.Scheduled End Date: Scheduled end date/time of the change. Date/time formatted as: Sat Jun 15 00:00:00-0500 2013
results.Scheduled Start Date: Scheduled start date/time of the change. Date/time formatted as: Sat Jun 15 00:00:00-0500 2013
results.Status: Status of the change request. A few stock BMC values include: Cancelled, Completed, Draft, Pending, Planning In Progress, Request for Authorization
results.SRID: Stock BMC change field used by Kinetic Request to store the associated Kinetic Request ID (CustomerSurveyID field from the KS_SRV_CustomerSurvey_base form.) Example value: KSR000000000042
results.SRInstanceID: Stock BMC change field used by Kinetic Request to store an associated CustomerSurveyInstanceId field off of the KS_SRV_CustomerSurvey_base form. Example value: AG00501196001CXe6wUQOvsjDweskK
results.SRMSAOIGuid: Stock BMC change field used by Kinetic Request to store the Kinetic Task deferal token.
results.Submitter: Remedy user id of the submitter for the change request.
results.Support Group Name: Support group chosen for the change request.
results.Support Organization: Support ogranization chosen for the change request.
results.Urgency: Chosen urgency value for the change. The value returned for this field will be formatted as it is displayed on the form. For example: 4-Low

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident Templated Create
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Incident (Help Desk) record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the specified Incident Template and parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Incidents are submitted through the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form. When creating Incidents via the Incident Management Template facility, the Instance Id of related template is retrieved using the template name parameter. The Instance Id is mapped to the TemplateID field on the HPD:IncidentInterface_Create form.  This causes Remedy workflow to map values from the template into the 'HPD:Help Desk' (Incidents) form. 

Additional information about the usage of Incident Management Templates can be found in the BMC Remedy ITSM Configurations guide. 

The following data is used to create the 'HPD:IncidentInterface_Create' record: 

* Maps the deferral token of the task instance generated by this handler into the 'SRMSAOIGuid' field. 

* Maps the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'z1D_Action'           => "CREATE" 

  - 'Reported Source'      => "Web" 

  - 'Service_Type'         => "User Service Request" 

  - 'Status'               => "New" 

* Maps the following field values to the values of the specified parameters: 

  - 'Last_Name'            => "Requester Last Name" 

  - 'First_Name'           => "Requester First Name" 

  - 'Submitter'            => "Submitter Login Id" 

  - 'SRID'                 => 'CustomerSurveyID' (the KSR number) 

  - 'SRInstanceID'         => 'CustomerSurveyInstanceId' (the Instance Id).

parameters.Incident Template Name:: The name of the incident template to submit with.
parameters.Requester First Name:: The value placed in the First Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Requester Last Name:: The value placed in the Last Name field on the Incident form.
parameters.Submitter Login Id:: The value placed in the Submitter field on the Incident form.
parameters.Survey ID (KSR #):: The value placed in the SRID field on the Incident form.
parameters.Survey Instance ID:: The value placed in the SRInstanceID field on the Incident form.

results.Incident Number: The 'Incident Number' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.
results.Incident Instance Id: The 'InstanceId' of the generated Incident in the HPD:Help Desk form.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM9 Work Order Create Detail
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM9 SRM Work Order record that contains the Id of the triggering Kinetic Request submission and the task instance deferral token using the parameters provided.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
This handler uses the WOI:WorkOrderInterface_Create form & functionality in ITSM to create work orders. This handler allows for creation of a work order without a template. 

Please be cautious hard coding shifting/frequently changing data like Remedy Group names into task trees. It is a better strategy to look up this data from somewhere (eg. a dataset in the Data Manageement Console or the Remedy Assignment Engine). 

Note that in 7.6.X version of ITSM, there have been issues reported with using WOI:WorkOrderInterface_Create to create work orders. This may need to be repaired in ITSM before this can effectively be used, but no changes are necessary in the handler.

handlerList.name: BMC ITSM7 Incident Work Info Create CE
handlerList.description: Creates a BMC ITSM7 Incident (Help Desk) Work Info record based upon the parameters provided. Meant for use with Request CE.
handlerList.detailedDescription:
Creates Work Info entries related to a Incident.  The relationship is established by placing the Incident ID in the 'Incident ID' field on the 'WOI:WorkInfo' form. 

The Include Review Request parameter invokes a method that builds and places a link in the Notes field on the Work Info entry.  When this link is clicked, the original service request submission is opened in the read-only Review Request mode. 

The Include Question Answers parameter invokes a method which builds a question and answer pair display of the service request submittal. These data elements are  placed in the Notes field of the Work Info entry.  This provides a quick view of the triggering service request submittal data. 

The Work Info entry accommodates up to three file attachments.  When configuring the task, this handler expects the value Menu Label of the attachment question. The handler will use this name to locate the attachment file within the Remedy forms of the Kinetic Request application. If more than three attachments are needed, it is recommended to create additional Work Info entries. 

This handler is safe to use in a subtree because it does not rely on any @base information to process. All data is passed into the handler as parameters. 

This handler allows for a configuration where the ARS system used for Kinetic and the ARS system used for BMC Remedy ITSM7 are different. 

The following data is used to create the 'WOI:WorkInfo' record: 

* Sets the 'Detailed Description' field to a concatenation of the following: 

  - The URL link to the Review Request view of the triggering Kinetic Request submission (if provided). 

  - The value of the "Work Info Notes" parameter. 

  - The formatted string of Question name to full answer pairs (if provided). 

* Sets the 'Incident Entry ID' field to the result of a lookup to the WOI:WorkOrder form.  The lookup is done using the Incident id parameter and the resulting entry's request id is used. 

* Attaches the files associated to the specified Attachment field menu label parameters to the specified fields: 

  - 'z2AF Work Log01'          => "Attachment Field 1" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log02'          => "Attachment Field 2" 

  - 'z2AF Work Log03'          => "Attachment Field 3" 

* Sets the following field values to the specified values: 

  - 'z1D Previous Operation'   => "SET"

  - 'Work Log Submitter'       => "Submitter" 

  - 'Secure Work Log'          => "No" 

  - 'View Access'              => "Internal" 

  - 'Communication Source'     => "Web" 

  - 'Work Log Type'            => "General Information"

parameters.Attachment Field 3:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment JSON 1:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment JSON 2:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Attachment JSON 3:: The Field Name of an attachment question to retrieve an attachment from.
parameters.Submitter:: Sets the Submitter of the Incident Work Info entry.
parameters.Locked:: Sets the Incident Work Info entry Locked status.
parameters.View Access:: Sets the Incident Work Info entry to Public or Internal.

handlers.name: GitLab
handlers.description: Handlers that interact with the Gitlab service (both Gitlab and self-hosted installations).

handlerList.name: GitLab Branch Create
handlerList.description: Creates a new branch in an existing GitLab project.
handlerList.detailedDescription: Creates a new branch using an existing branch or commit SHA in an existing GitLab project using a user's private token (obtained in GitLab under the intended user's 'Settings' => 'Account'). The source location for the new branch is found through providing the projects path (which is the project name provided in the URL - not necessarily the same as the readable name) and an existing branch or commit SHA. Once this is found, the new branch will be created with the given name and the previously found source. An empty result set will be returned on a successful branch creation.

parameters.Project Group: Path of the group where the project is located (defaults to the GitLab default group if not provided).
parameters.Project Path: Path of the project where the branch should be created.
parameters.Branch Source: Name of another branch to use as a source for the new branch (can also use a commit SHA).

1.description: * Initial version.  See README for details.

handlerList.changelogText:
GitLab Branch Create V1 (2017-10-02)
 * Initial version.  See README for details.

handlerList.name: GitLab File Create
handlerList.description: Creates a new file in an existing GitLab project.
handlerList.detailedDescription: Creates a new file in an existing GitLab project and branch using a user's private token (obtained in GitLab under the inteded user's 'Settings' => 'Account') and the location, name, and contents of the file that should be added. The project the file should be added to is found through providing the projects path (which is the project name provided in the URL - not necessarily the same as the readable name) and the project group (if it is in something other than the default group). The file and the location it should be placed at is built based upon the branch, folder, file name, and file contents parameters. If the branch provided doesn't currently exist, it will be created upon successful addition of the file. An empty result set will be returned on successful file creation.

parameters.Project Group: Path of the group where the project and branch are located (defaults to the GitLab default group if not provided).
parameters.Project Path: Path of the project where the branch is located.
parameters.Branch: Branch that the file should be added to.
parameters.Folder: Path to a folder to create the file in (if left blank, file will be created in the root folder).
parameters.File Name: Name of the file (including the desired extension).
parameters.Commit Message: Commit message that the file will be added with.

handlerList.name: GitLab Project Create
handlerList.description: Creates a new project in GitLab.
handlerList.detailedDescription: Creates a new project in the given GitLab instance using a user's private token (obtained in GitLab under the intended user's 'Settings' => 'Account') and information about the new project. If the new project should be placed under an existing group, the handler first has to do a search to retrieve the id for a group matching the inputted path. A POST object is then created using the name/path (at least one is required to be provided), the group id (if a group was provdied), as well as any of the remaining input parameters. If any errors are caught on the creation attempt they will be caught and raised along with the error code and message. If there are no errors, an id for the newly created project will be returned.

parameters.Name: Readable name for the new project (if not provided the path will determine the name).
parameters.Path: URL path for the new project (if not provided the name will determine the path).
parameters.Description: Description of the new project.
parameters.Group: Path for the group that the project should be placed in.
parameters.Default Branch: Default branch for the project (if not provided, default is master).
parameters.Visibility: Visibility options are 'private', 'internal', or 'public'. Will default to the group or organization default if not provided.

sampleConfiguration.Name: My Test Project
sampleConfiguration.Description: A test repository created by test.user

results.Project Id: If the project is succesfully created, the id for the newly created project

handlerList.name: GitLab Branch Protect
handlerList.description: Protects a specified branch in an existing GitLab project.
handlerList.detailedDescription: Protects a specified branch through push and merge rules in an existing GitLab project using a user's private token (obtained in GitLab under the intended user's 'Settings' => 'Account'). The branch to be protected is found through providing the projects path (which is the project name provided in the URL - not necessarily the same as the readable name) and the branch name. Once the project is found, the push and merge capabilities can be enforced in the following 3 levels: 'none' means no one can modify the branch while 'masters'/'developers' map to the 'Master'/'Developer' GitLab Member permissions for the specified project. If 'Allowed to push' or 'Allowed to merge' is not provided, it will either stay the same as before if edited an already protected branch or default to 'masters' if this is a new protected branch. An empty result set will be returned on a successful branch protection attempt.

parameters.Project Group: Path of the group where the project and branch are located (defaults to the GitLab default group if not provided).
parameters.Project Path: Path of the project where the branch is located.
parameters.Allowed To Push: Who should be allowed to push to the branch: 'none','masters','developers'.
parameters.Allowed To Merge: Who should be allowed to merge to the branch: 'none','masters','developers'.

1.description: * Initial version.  See README for details.

handlerList.name: GitLab Webhook Create
handlerList.description: Creates a new webhook for an existing GitLab project.
handlerList.detailedDescription: Creates a new webhook using a user's private token (obtained in GitLab under the intended user's 'Settings' => 'Account') and the new webhook information. The URL and Secret Token are values that are used to build and send the request when a GitLab action fires the webhook (a secret token is not required) while trigger events determine when the webhook is triggered. For more information on configuring webhooks in GitLab, see GitLab's general webhook documentation (https://gitlab.com/help/user/project/integrations/webhooks). If the webhook is successfully created, the newly created webhook id will be returned in the results.

parameters.Project Group: Path of the group where the project is located (defaults to the GitLab default group if not provided).
parameters.Project Path: Path of the project where the branch should be created.
parameters.Secret Token: Secret Token for the webhook (send with the webhook request in the X-Gitlab-Token header).
parameters.Enable SSL Verification: Do SSL verification when the webhook is triggered ('true' or 'false').
parameters.Trigger Events: A comma separated list of events that will trigger the webhook. Options are: 'push','issues','merge','tag_push','note','job','pipeline','wiki'.

results.Webhook Id: If the webhook was successfully created, the id of the newly created webhook.
